stem: Given question: What might a teacher do most during a week? and answer: work in school, explain why in
no_more_50_words: Teachers are usually employed at schools, and most people work during weekdays.
150_to_200_words:
During a typical week, a teacher has many tasks to attend to. At school, a teacher will teach classes, monitor students in the classroom, and help them with any questions they may have. They will also need to prepare lesson plans and materials for upcoming classes, grade assignments and tests, and record student progress. A teacher also might need to attend faculty meetings, collaborate with colleagues on instructional strategies, and meet with parents to discuss student performance. 

Outside of school, a teacher may need to attend professional development events, create and review course curriculum, or write assessments and evaluations. Depending on the school, they may also need to participate in extracurricular activities and clubs, such as sports teams, after-school clubs, or student government. 

No matter the tasks, a teacher will work to create a positive learning environment for their students. They will provide guidance and support to help their students reach their full potential. A teacher is an important part of a student's education, and their dedication and hard work is essential in helping students succeed.
